**Benefit:** You can use the {skill/Bluff} skill to demoralize opponents in combat instead of {skill/Intimidate}. You can attempt a Bluff check in place of an Intimidate check when using the {feat/Dazzling Display} feat and feats that list Dazzling Display as a prerequisite. If you use the Bluff skill to demoralize, you cannot use it to feint until the beginning of your next turn, and vice versa.

encouraging_spell.name: Encouraging Spell
description: ## Encouraging Spell (Metamagic)
{SOURCE Magic Tactics Toolbox/5}
Your inspiration provides your allies with greater support.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 13, Diplomacy 6 ranks.
**Benefit:** Any morale bonus granted by an encouraging spell is increased by 1. An encouraging spell uses up a spell slot 1 level higher than the spell's actual level.

endurance.name: Endurance
description: ## Endurance
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/122}
Harsh conditions or long exertions do not easily tire you.

**Benefit:** You gain a +4 bonus on the following checks and saves: Swim checks made to resist nonlethal damage from exhaustion; Constitution checks made to continue running; Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from a forced march; Constitution checks made to hold your breath; Constitution checks made to avoid nonlethal damage from starvation or thirst; Fortitude saves made to avoid nonlethal damage from hot or cold environments; and Fortitude saves made to resist damage from suffocation.
You may sleep in light or medium armor without becoming fatigued.
**Normal:** A character without this feat who sleeps in medium or heavier armor is {misc/fatigued} the next day.
### Mythic Endurance
{SOURCE Mythic Adventures/65}
Your endurance is truly beyond the pale.
**Prerequisites:** Endurance.

**Benefit:** The bonus on checks and saves from Endurance increases by half your tier. You take half the damage when you fail a check to avoid nonlethal damage from a forced march, starvation and thirst, hot or cold environments, or slow suffocation.
You can sleep in heavy armor without becoming fatigued.

endure_pain_zon_kuthons_kiss.name: Endure Pain (Zon-Kuthon's Kiss)
description: ## Endure Pain (Zon-Kuthon's Kiss)
{SOURCE Cities of Golarion/42}
Through violent and torturous conditioning, you have built up a resistance to pain.
**Prerequisites:** Survived being tortured 10 or more times.

**Benefit:** If you take nonlethal damage, you may attempt a Fortitude saving throw (DC equal to 10 + the nonlethal damage dealt) to reduce that damage by half. The Endurance feat grants a +4 bonus on this saving throw.

enduring_might.name: Enduring Might
description: ## Enduring Might
{SOURCE Martial Arts Handbook/29}
When you gather your might, it lasts long enough to improve your defenses and attacks of opportunity.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Gather Might}.
**Benefit:** When you use {feat/Gather Might}, the ability score bonuses last until the beginning of your next turn.

enemy_cult.name: Enemy Cult
description: ## Enemy Cult (Story)
{SOURCE Horror Adventures/86}
You have crossed paths with a cult opposed to everything in which you believe.
**Prerequisites:** You must have encountered a cult whose general alignment is opposite to yours on at least one axis or who threatened your beliefs or way of life.

**Benefit:** Choose an appropriate {spell/detect [chaos/]evil[/good/law]} spell that would aid you in opposing your chosen enemy cult. You can cast this spell twice per day as a spell-like ability with a caster level equal to your character level.
**Goal:** Thwart the enemy cult, whose leader must be a challenging foe. You must deal that cult leader a decisive defeat, and additionally eradicate the cult or drive the cult from the area.

**Completion Benefit:** You gain a +2 resistance bonus on saving throws against evil creatures and a +2 deflection bonus to AC against evil creatures' attacks. These bonuses double against evil summoned creatures.

energized_wild_shape.name: Energized Wild Shape
description: ## Energized Wild Shape
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/110}
Your wild shape form gains the benefits of one energy type for both offensive and defensive purposes.
**Prerequisites:** Wis 19, base attack bonus +6, wild shape class feature.

**Benefit:** When you assume a wild shape form, choose one of the following energy types: acid, cold, electricity, or fire. You gain resistance 10 to that energy type. Also, one of your natural attacks deals an additional 1d6 points of damage of the chosen energy type. If you choose a wild shape form that already has energy resistance of the same type you choose, it increases by 5 instead. If you choose a wild shape form that deals damage of the same energy type you choose, increase the energy damage you deal by one die size (1d6 becomes 1d8, and so on).
**Special:** You can take this feat more than once. Each time you take this feat, choose a different energy type.

energy_channel.name: Energy Channel
description: ## Energy Channel
{SOURCE Advanced Class Guide/146}
You distill your channeled energy into your weapon to empower it.
**Prerequisites:** {ability/Channel energy} class feature; Air, Earth, Fire, or Water domain or blessing.

**Benefit:** A swift action, you can expend one use of channel energy to grant your weapon attacks a bonus on damage rolls equal to twice the number of dice rolled for your channel energy. This additional damage is of an energy type determined by your domain or blessing: acid (Earth), cold (Water), electricity (Air), or fire (Fire). If you have more than one of those domains or blessings, you must choose one of those damage types when you use this ability. This effect lasts for your next three weapon attacks or until the end of combat, whichever comes first.

energy_mastery.name: Energy Mastery
description: ## Energy Mastery (Item Mastery)
{SOURCE Weapon Master's Handbook/26}
You can project energy from evocation magic items.
**Prerequisites:** Use Magic Device 1 rank, base Fortitude save bonus +4.

**Benefit:** You can cause an item that has a 1st level or higher evocation spell with the acid, cold, electricity, or fire descriptor in its construction requirements to cast {spell/burning hands}. The spell has the energy descriptor from the appropriate requirement spell and deals that type of damage instead of fire damage. You can use this feat once per day, plus an additional time per day at base Fortitude save bonus +6, +8, +10, and +12.

You can spend two daily uses of this feat to cast {spell/lightning bolt} this way if the spell listed in the item's construction requirements is at least 3rd level (still dealing a type of energy damage appropriate to that spell).

enfilading_fire.name: Enfilading Fire
description: ## Enfilading Fire (Combat, Teamwork)
{SOURCE Ultimate Combat/100}
Your ranged attacks take advantage of the {rule/flanking} maneuvers of allies.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Point-Blank Shot}, {feat/Precise Shot}, one other {main/feats_<teamwork/ feat}.
**Benefit:** You receive a +2 bonus on ranged attacks made against a foe flanked by 1 or more allies with this feat.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/119}
>Before making a ranged attack roll, you can spend 1 stamina point to gain the benefits of this feat against a target that is flanked by two or more allies, even if those allies don't have this feat.

enforcer.name: Enforcer
description: ## Enforcer (Combat)
{SOURCE Advanced Player's Guide/159;Pathfinder Campaign Setting/125}
You are skilled at causing fear in those you brutalize.
**Prerequisites:** Intimidate 1 rank.

**Benefit:** Whenever you deal nonlethal damage with a melee weapon, you can make an Intimidate check to demoralize your target as a free action. If you are successful, the target is {misc/shaken} for a number of rounds equal to the damage dealt. If your attack was a critical hit, your target is frightened for 1 round with a successful Intimidate check, as well as being shaken for a number of rounds equal to the damage dealt.
>**Combat Trick** (from the {feat/Combat Stamina} feat)
>{SOURCE Pathfinder Unchained/119}
>When you score a critical hit with a weapon dealing nonlethal damage, you can spend 5 stamina points to frighten the target for 1d4 rounds instead of 1 round.

engulf_horror.name: Engulf Horror
description: ## Engulf Horror (Combat)
{SOURCE Horror Adventures/86}
The repulsive horror of your smothering attack nearly incapacitates most foes.
**Prerequisites:** {feat/Engulf Revulsion}; {umr/engulf} or {umr/smother} universal monster ability.

**Benefit:** When you successfully engulf or smother an opponent, successfully maintain a grapple combat maneuver on a smothered opponent, the opponent must succeed at a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your Hit Dice + your Strength modifier) or become {misc/staggered} for 1 round. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.

engulf_revulsion.name: Engulf Revulsion
description: ## Engulf Revulsion (Combat)
{SOURCE Horror Adventures/86}
The stomach-churning terror of your smothering attack leaves creatures sick and weakened.
**Prerequisites:** {umr/Engulf} or {umr/smother} universal monster ability.

**Benefit:** When you successfully engulf or smother an opponent, or successfully maintain a grapple combat maneuver on an engulfed or smothered opponent, that opponent must succeed at a Will save (DC = 10 + 1/2 your Hit Dice + your Strength modifier) or become {misc/shaken} for 1 round. This is a mind-affecting fear effect.

enhanced_coven.name: Enhanced Coven
description: ## Enhanced Coven
{SOURCE Blood of the Coven/13}
By deepening your connection with your coven members, you have made your coven capable of casting more spells each day.
**Prerequisites:** {race/Changeling}, {hex/coven} hex or {feat/Coven-Touched}.
**Benefit:** Your changeling coven can cast three more spells each day from its list of spell-like abilities. If multiple members of your coven take this feat, the benefits stack.

enhanced_gnome_magic.name: Enhanced Gnome Magic
description: ## Enhanced Gnome Magic
{SOURCE Ultimate Wilderness/110}
Your ties to the First World manifest in the form of magical abilities that tap into a natural element.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 13, Knowledge (nature) 3 ranks, {race/gnome}, gnome magic racial trait.

**Benefit:** Add one of the following to your gnome magic spell-like abilities: {spell/burning hands}, {spell/corrosive touch}, {spell/gentle breeze}, {spell/icicle dagger}, or {spell/shocking grasp}. You can use this spell-like ability once per day.

enhanced_ki_throw.name: Enhanced Ki Throw
description: ## Enhanced Ki Throw (Combat)
{SOURCE Dragon Empires Primer/24}
You enhance the force of your ki throws, enabling you to devastate your opponents as you slam them to the ground.
**Prerequisites:** Ki pool class feature, {feat/Ki Throw}.

**Benefit:** When using the Ki Throw feat, you can expend 1 ki point to amplify the force of your attack. If your ki throw succeeds, when the target hits the ground, it takes damage as if you had hit it with an unarmed strike.

enlarge_spell.name: Enlarge Spell
description: ## Enlarge Spell (Metamagic)
{SOURCE PRPG Core Rulebook/122}
You can increase the range of your spells.

**Benefit:** You can alter a spell with a range of close, medium, or long to increase its range by 100%. An enlarged spell with a range of close now has a range of 50 ft. + 5 ft./level, while medium-range spells have a range of 200 ft. + 20 ft./level and long-range spells have a range of 800 ft. + 80 ft./level. An enlarged spell uses up a spell slot one level higher than the spell's actual level.
Spells whose ranges are not defined by distance, as well as spells whose ranges are not close, medium, or long, do not benefit from this feat.

enlightened_noble.name: Enlightened Noble
description: ## Enlightened Noble
{SOURCE Heroes of the High Court/4}
You to excel in a particular area thanks to your noble family's field of expertise.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 13, {feat/Noble Scion}, Knowledge (nobility) 1 rank.
**Benefit:** You gain an additional benefit based on the flavor of your noble family chosen with the {feat/Noble Scion} feat.
>@HL[Scion of the Arts:] A number of times per day equal to your Charisma modifier, you can roll 2d20 for a Perform check and take the better result.
>@HL[Scion of Lore:] You can attempt Knowledge skill checks untrained. If you have 10 or more ranks in a Knowledge skill, the bonus from Scion of Lore increases to +2 for that skill.
>@HL[Scion of Magic:] Once per day, you can gain a +2 bonus to caster level on a {rule/concentration} check, a Use Magic Device check, or a check to overcome spell resistance.
>@HL[Scion of Peace:] Choose one Wisdom-based skill. Once per day when you take 10 on this skill, you treat the result as if you had rolled an 18 instead of a 10.

>@HL[Scion of War:] After rolling initiative, you can attempt a Bluff check as an immediate action to feint against a creature or an Intimidate check to demoralize a creature. This can only affect creatures that act after you in the initiative count.

ennobled_resistances.name: Ennobled Resistances
description: ## Ennobled Resistances
{SOURCE Heroes of the High Court/23}
The protection and resilience granted by your investiture is particularly strong.
**Prerequisites:** Investiture class feature, character level 4th.
**Benefit:** When you improve one of your saving throws with your investiture class feature as a swift action, select a second type of saving throw to gain the same bonus.

enrage_opponent.name: Enrage Opponent
description: ## Enrage Opponent (Combat, Panache)
{SOURCE Ultimate Intrigue/82}
With a quip or a suggestive gesture, you send your enemy into a tizzy.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 13, {feat/Persuasive}, either {feat/Amateur Swashbuckler} or the panache class feature.

**Benefit:** As a swift action, you can spend 1 panache point to enrage a creature with an Intelligence of 4 or more within 60 feet that can see or hear you. Attempt an Intimidate check as if to demoralize the creature. If you succeed, the creature takes a -2 penalty to its AC until it has made at least one attack against you (including area effects that include you) or until it can no longer see or hear you. You can have only one opponent enraged at you with this feat at a time, and once you've enraged a creature, you can't enrage it again for 24 hours.

ensemble.name: Ensemble
description: ## Ensemble (Teamwork)
{SOURCE Ultimate Magic/149}
You can create an ensemble of skilled and amateur performers to aid you in your performance.
**Prerequisites:** Perform 5 ranks

**Benefit:** When you are performing, allies within 20 feet who also have this feat can aid you with your Perform checks (including those made as part of {ability/bardic performance}) as if they were {rule/aid[ing] another} as an immediate action. The allies make their aid another rolls before you make your check. No more than four allies can grant you a bonus with aid another. Allies aiding you do not need to use the same category of the Perform skill that you are using in order to aid you.

**Special:** If you possess one or more levels of the bard class, you can choose any one ally within 20 feet to be part of the ensemble. The ally is considered to have the Ensemble teamwork feat for the purposes of aiding your performance.

entreating_critical.name: Entreating Critical
description: ## Entreating Critical (Combat, Critical)
{SOURCE Ultimate Intrigue/82}
Your critical hit allows you a chance to make your foes briefly see reason.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 15, {feat/Call Truce}, {feat/Critical Focus}, {feat/Persuasive}, base attack bonus +11, Diplomacy 5 ranks.

**Benefit:** Whenever you confirm a critical hit, the shock of the attack momentarily opens an opportunity to end hostilities with a quick entreaty. As an immediate action immediately after confirming the critical hit, you can attempt a Diplomacy check to improve the target's attitude as though you had spent 1 full round using the Call Truce feat. All other conditions and limitations of the Call Truce feat apply.

entwining_stare.name: Entwining Stare
description: ## Entwining Stare (Stare)
{SOURCE Blood of the Beast/17}
Your painful stare makes your enemies easier to grab and constrict.
**Prerequisites:** Mesmerist level 7th, painful stare class feature.
**Benefit:** When you trigger your painful stare to add damage to an attack with {umr/grab}, the target takes a -4 penalty to its CMD against the grab's grapple combat maneuver attempt.

ephemeral_tread.name: Ephemeral Tread
description: ## Ephemeral Tread
{SOURCE Plane-Hopper's Handbook/30}
You are able to gain some abilities of a lucid dreamer while in your corporeal form.
**Prerequisites:** Cha 15, {feat/Lucid Dreamer}, Knowledge (planes) 5 ranks.

**Benefit:** Once per day, when you are in the {rule/Dimension of Dreams>_oa} in your physical body, you can attempt an impossible action as a standard action as though you were in a lucid body. No positive modifiers can be applied to this roll other than your Charisma modifier.

equipment_trick.name: Equipment Trick
description: ## Equipment Trick (Combat)
{SOURCE Adventurer's Armory/22}
Choose a piece of equipment, such as an boots, a cloak, rope, a shield, or a heavy blade scabbard. You understand how to use that piece of equipment in combat.
**Prerequisites:** Base attack bonus +1.

**Benefit:** You can use any Equipment Trick related to the chosen item as long as you meet the trick's prerequisites. If the item would normally be considered an {misc/improvised weapon}, you can treat it as either a normal weapon or an improvised weapon, depending on which is more beneficial for you.
**Special:** You can gain Equipment Trick multiple times. Each time you take the feat, it applies to a new type of equipment. (These are listed as separate feats for reading convenience.)
